snippet: Analysts say an Iraqi boom should cushion oil markets from price spikes and offer relief for the West as it tightens sanctions on Iran.
abstract: Iraq's crude oil production is soaring, providing a singular bright spot for the nation’s future and relief for global oil markets as the West tightens sanctions on Iranian exports; increased flow and vital port improvements have produced a 20 percent jump in exports this year to nearly 2.5 million barrels of oil a day, making Iraq one of the premier producers in OPEC for the first time in decades.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Baghdad, and Clifford Krauss from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Analysts say an Iraqi boom should cushion oil markets from price spikes and offer relief for the West as it tightens sanctions on Iran.

headline.seo: Crude Oil Output Is Soaring in Iraq, Easing Markets
headline.main: Oil Output Soars as Iraq Retools, Easing Shaky Markets
headline.print_headline: Oil Output Soars as Iraq Retools
